flavor: Designed by 2012 World Champion Jeremy Zwirn
text:
Architect cannot be trashed while installed.
[Subroutine] The Corp looks at the top 5 cards of R&D and may install 1 of those cards, ignoring all install costs.
[Subroutine] The Corp may install a card from Archives or HQ (paying all costs).
title: Architect

text: Gain 1[Credits] for each rezzed piece of ice.
title: Peak Efficiency

text: Place 2 power counters on Labyrinthine Servers when you score it. Hosted power counter: Prevent the Runner from jacking out. The Runner cannot jack out for the remainder of this run.
title: Labyrinthine Servers

flavor: The way past is to go a different way.
text: Ashigaru gains "[Subroutine] End the run." for each card in HQ.
title: Ashigaru

text: Hosted power counter: Do 1 net damage. Use this ability only during a run. [Subroutine] Do 1 net damage. [Subroutine] You and the Runner secretly spend 0[Credits], 1[Credits], or 2[Credits]. Reveal spent credits. If you and the Runner spent a different number of credits, place 1 power counter on Mamba.
title: Mamba

flavor: Making a name for yourself has its perks. But it also makes you a target.
text:
Reversed Accounts can be advanced.
[Click], [Trash]: The Runner loses 4[Credits] for each advancement token on Reversed Accounts.
title: Reversed Accounts

flavor: "It's a small one-time fee, apparently. Only I've paid it seventeen times."
text: [Subroutine] The Runner loses 1[Credits] unless the Runner is tagged. If the Runner is tagged, he or she loses all credits in his or her credit pool and the Corp trashes Universal Connectivity Fee.
title: Universal Connectivity Fee

text: When your turn begins, you may add 1 rezzed card to HQ and gain credits equal to its rez cost.
title: Blue Sun: Powering the Future

text: Changeling can be advanced. While Changeling has an odd number of advancement tokens on it, it gains sentry and loses barrier. [Subroutine] End the run.
title: Changeling

flavor: If the clones were nervous about living in a repurposed fuel tank, they never mentioned it.
text:
As an additional cost to play this operation, spend [Click].
Trash any number of cards from HQ. Gain 2[Credits] for each card trashed.
title: Reuse

text:
When your turn begins, you may add 1 card from Archives to the bottom of R&D.
Limit 1 per deck.
title: Hades Fragment

text:
[Click], [Click]: Place 1 power counter on Docklands Crackdown.
The install cost of the first card the Runner installs each turn is increased by 1 for each power counter on Docklands Crackdown.
title: Docklands Crackdown

flavor: "Knowledge comes in many different shapes and sizes." -Quetzal
text: Reveal the top 4 cards of your stack and trash all programs revealed. Gain 1[Credits] for each program trashed, and add the rest of the revealed cards to your grip.
title: Inject

flavor: The earliest instances of data folding were inspired by the traditional art of origami. Just as a crease pattern is the blueprint of a paper crane, there is a sequence to data that must be considered in order to achieve the greatest result.
text: Your maximum hand size is increased by 1 for each copy of Origami installed.
title: Origami

flavor: "You should have known better than to scratch it…" -Quetzal
text: Whenever the Corp purges virus counters, he or she loses 2[Credits], if able.
title: Fester

flavor: It practically runs itself, unless you're in a pinch.
text:
The first time you install a program from your grip during your turn, gain [Click].
Trash Autoscripter if you make an unsuccessful run.
title: Autoscripter

flavor: Small. Compact. Easy to slip by monitoring programs and it can do some damage.
text: 1[Credits]: Break any number of sentry subroutines. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card. 1[Credits]: +7 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
title: Switchblade

text:
As an additional cost to play this event, trash an installed piece of hardware.
Gain credits equal to half the install cost of the trashed hardware (rounded down) and search your stack for a piece of hardware, reveal it, and add it to your grip. Shuffle your stack.
title: Trade-In

flavor: "There is no better tool for charting the empty spaces of the net." -Nasir Meidan
text: +1[Memory Unit] Draw 1 card whenever the Corp creates a server. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Astrolabe

flavor: "Low gravity sports are wildly popular, so match-fixing has proven wildly profitable." -Leela Patel
text: Place X power counters on Angel Arena when it is installed. When there are no power counters left on Angel Arena, trash it. Hosted power counter: Reveal the top card of your stack. You may add that card to the bottom of your stack.
title: Angel Arena
